description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the denial of service vulnerability in Windows Hyper-V (CVE-2024-21408), follow these steps:

1. Download and apply the relevant updates for your Windows version from the official Microsoft Update Catalog.

    - Windows 10 (20H2 and 21H2): Apply KB5035858.
    - Windows 10 (22H2): Apply KB5035845.
    - Windows 11 (21H2): Apply KB5035854.
    - Windows 11 (22H2 and 23H2): Apply KB5035853.

2. Restart your system after the installation is complete to ensure all changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This fix addresses a critical denial of service issue which can allow an attacker to exploit the vulnerability through local or remote methods.
- For manual installation, download the update packages from:
    - [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
    - [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)
    - [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
    - [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that Hyper-V is installed and running on your system.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the updates.
